title: 3D World - Issue 102: Content Disc
description:
This came from 3D World magazine, their 102nd issue. This is the back side of the DVD with content spanning many different areas. ISO Format, converted and image burned by Draelren.

Burn tested, Windows and Mac approved!

Warning from 3D World Magazine, as printed on back of DVD case:
This is a Future Technology DVD-ROM. This disc has been thoroughly scanned and tested at all stages of production - but, as with any new software - we still recommend that you run a virus scan before use. We also recommend that you have an up-to-date backup of your local drive. Future cannot accept responsibility for any disruption, damage, and/or loss to your data or computer system that may occur while using this disc, or the programs, and data held within. Consult your network administrator before installing software on a networked PC.

Software:

imageSynth
Turn seed images into seamlessly tiling textures with Luxology&#039;s texture creation plug-in for Photoshop CS and above.


HDR and Textures:

3six0
A high-quality High Dynamic Range Image from this online stock library plus links to download free commercial use backgrounds.

3D Total Textures
12 tiling textures of alien skin from 3D Total&#039;s Total Texture collections, with bump and specular maps.


Models, Scenes, and Productions:

DAZ 3D Vegetation
Add instant greenery to your Poser scenes with this commercially licensed set of EasyPose jungle vines and moss

Runtime DNA Assets
A varied set of commercial Poser props, clothing and scripts from Runtime DNA&#039;s Michael Ebert Tribute collection

Vehicle Models
Three high-quality vehicles from 3d02.com, complete with textures, plus two further bonus models. (Jetta, 1007, and Countach)


Projects:

Optimus &#039;Magma&#039;

Zune &#039;Tron&#039;

Terminus


Training and Tutorials:

Vue Training Videos
Two complete video tutorials for Vue, complete with commercial bonus assets, recorded by Geekatplay Studio

Gnomon Training
Learn to sketch dinosaurs the Hollywood way with this 10 minute tutorial from leading concept artist David Krentz

Tutorials
Supporting files for our tutorials and Q&A&#039;s including over seven hours of bonus cover tutorial footage
